p: Immunohistochemical methods are using cross-reactive polyclonal or type-specific mAbs against viral structure antigens ( Miagostovich et al., 1997) or NS proteins such as NS3 ( Balsitis et al., 2009). These antibodies can be conjugated to fluorescein ( Boonpucknavig et al., 1981), avidinâ€“biotin peroxidase ( Waterman and Monath, 1982), or alkaline phosphatase ( Hall et al., 1991).
